title: Brighton plea with Premier League for 'nonsense' experience of fans to be addressed during VAR decisions
text:
Brighton and Hove Albion have asked the Premier League to address the "nonsense" experience of fans in stadiums being kept in the dark during VAR decisions.

Paul Barber, the club's chief executive, has written to league officials after disallowed goals in consecutive weeks against West Ham and then Southampton caused widespread confusion at the Amex.

He said both overturned decisions were eventually proved to be "correct", but the second goal in particular left "30,000 people in the stadium with absolutely no idea what was going on".

Barber claimed it was "just a nonsense" that current rules forbid clubs from showing any clips of live VAR reviews on big screens, even though fans at home can watch on their televisions.

"Half the people that guess thought it was a foul on the goalkeeper, the other half thought it was offside," he said. "That's not good. We immediately wrote to the Premier League and PGMOL and said 'we were supporters of VAR, we're still supporting VAR, but we must absolutely protect the in stadium experience'.
description: Brighton and Hove Albion have asked the Premier League to address the "nonsense" experience of fans in stadiums being kept in the dark during VAR decisions.
